```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  It focuses on a public health issue (West Nile Virus) and preventative measures.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its content addresses a public health concern relevant to a wide audience in Romania. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad target audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post is to raise public awareness about West Nile Virus prevention, not to influence votes for any particular candidate or party. The content is educational and informative, focusing on public health.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information on a public health issue in a manner consistent with journalistic reporting. It cites a biologist's opinion and provides factual information about preventative measures and government spending on the issue. While it is a paid advertisement, the content itself is not overtly biased or designed to sway public opinion towards a specific political outcome.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions unrelated to the subject matter. The information presented is factual and sourced.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>490076993441008</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, focusing on West Nile Virus prevention, does not constitute electoral propaganda.  While it's a paid advertisement, the content is purely informational and educational, addressing a public health concern. It does not mention any parliamentary candidates, parties, or attempt to influence voting behavior. The post's objective is to raise public awareness and promote preventative measures against the virus.  The use of a biologist's quote adds credibility to the information presented, further reinforcing its journalistic nature.  There is no evidence to suggest an intention to influence the parliamentary elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Videomedicina.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
